marklogic.body:
Well being fat isn't very much fun, sorry but it is true. Â I quit smoking and had a pretty bad knee injury and was laid up for almost 3 months. Â It was the greatest three months of my life, all I did was sit in a recliner, eat, and play video games. Â I also Gained 40 pounds.
The health problems were numerous. Â I couldn't breath, especially at night, and especially when sleeping on my back which I had to do because of my knee. Â I had terrible heart Burn all the time and couldn't eat any of the stuff I used to be able to eat, especially spicy foods which I love.
Then I noticed I started to slow down. Â I'd be going up or down stairs and I couldn't move my legs like I used to be able to. Â Not due to the injury either, I just couldn't move like I wanted to, or like I was able to in the past.
My resting heart rate was up near 100 and I had high blood pressure. Â For the first time in my life I had started to feel pretty bad about myself and my self esteem was in the tank, whichÂ virtuallyÂ affected every single part of my life.
Thankfully I had the willpower to turn it all around, I've lost the extra 40 pounds and am now working on the last 20 to get back down to my college weight. Â I feel better, my health is better, my blood pressure is back to normal, my resting heart rate is back in the 70s, Â I can run again, I can breath now and taste foods since I quit smoking, I don't drink much anymore which improved my life also.
There is a reason to be healthy, other than the shallow reasons that many point out, like beauty or what have you.
I do reject that fat isÂ beautiful, because it simply isn't, eye of the beholder or otherwise.
